column4: displayName
ProMetaS Sensor Metadata
description
The short human-readable name of the system or object (usually less than 30 characters). (eg: 2070 Gamma Detector)
Type of the sensor, application specific. The vocabulary can also be referred from the link: (http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/W06/current/CLSS0002/) (eg: Temperature Sensor)
Description of where the sensor is positioned. (eg: At Inlet)
Unique Identifier for Sensor(s). (eg: TS7104)
The organization responsible for building the sensor(s) (system).(eg: Guide Analog and Digital Systeme GmbH)
A unique alpha-numeric designation identifying a particular piece of equipment.(eg: TSensor1)
An alpha-numeric designation identifying a particular model and version of equipment. (eg: 7000)
Absolute accuracy describes how close a measured value is to a known absolute true value, usually provided in the same unit as the measured value itself. (eg: 0.3)
Relative accuracy (or relative error) is a description of how close a measured value is to the known true value on relative terms, that is relative to the size of the measured value itself. (eg: 0.3)
The application for which the sensor(s) is used. (eg: Water Temperature Measurement)
A piece of software (optionally executed on a System component) used to transform digital data provided as input to new data on its output. (eg: Banner Sensor GUI)
Unique name or number assigned to identify a given state of development of a piece of computer software (eg: version 1.2)
General description of the Sensor. For example: It could be about its capability. (eg: The sensor is used to intended to be used to measure temperature of water in range 0-80 degree Celsius.)
Platform in which the sensor is mounted. Support base that holds the sensor. (eg: Fixtures)
Whether sensor is calibrated or not (true or false) (eg: True)
Description of Process/Methods of how the sensor was calibrated  (eg: Calibration with the help of a Simulator)
The Date when it was calibrated in ISO-8601 format.  (eg: 2022-02-15)
Link to certificate
Data being sent by the component (sensor system). This property is for data that is being transmitted, not for data that is available. (eg: Binary)
Output Data Format of Sensor (eg: csv)
Description of how the sensor is used for the Use case. (eg: The sensor is used to detect inlet temperature of water.)
Parameters of the sensor that is set for experimentation.
Name of the parameter
Value for the parameter
Any link to previous Dataset
It refers to the degree of reproducibility of a measurement
The value of Precision (eg: 0.5)
Unit of a measurement in accordance to ISO-80000 standard (eg degree celsius)
Description of how the sensor was mounted. (eg: The sensor is mounted parallel to the ground)
Lower Bound Measurement of Sensor (eg: 0)
Upper Bound Measurement of Sensor (eg: 90)
Unit in which the sensor does its measurement according to ISO-80000 Standard (eg: degree celsius)
List of Signal of Sensor used for the process. For example: list of specific signals for the process.
Number of Sensor Used (eg: 5)
Rate at which data is read by the sensor.
Value at which data is read by the sensor. (eg: 8.2)
Unit of Sampling rate by sensor according to ISO-80000 standard. (Example: Khz )
Additional information pertaining to Sensor can be highlighted.
identifier
